moves.1. e4: This was the first of a number of "Calendar Challenges". The all-female team "~Sixth Sense~" have made a calendar featuring some of the ladies in the team. I am hoping to play all the players featured on the calendar.
moves.1... c5: So I start with my usual - The Sicilian Defence.
moves.2... e6: So this blunts the Bishop's scope.
moves.3. Nf3: White decides to switch to the normal open variation after all.
moves.3... Nc6: I usually meet Nf3 with Nc6, challenging the same central squares, e5 and d4.
moves.6. Bg5: She saves the pawn by pinning the knight, but this runs into....
moves.6... Qa5+: This check, which also hits the bishop on g4. Now she can't put the queen in the way, as I simply exchange queens and take the knight on d4, so the only way to save the pieces is....
moves.7. Bd2: This move, which unprotects the Nd4, but I can't take it immediately as my queen is attacked, so....
moves.7... Qc5: Now I am threatening both the knight on d4 and the bishop on c4. Now the only way for Black to save the piece is Nxc6, and although black's position is not very good, at least material balance is maintained, for instance, 8.	Nxc6	Qxc4 9. Na5 Qxe4+ 10.	Kf1 b6 11. Nb3	Bb7 12. f3 Qf5 was sasusa (1643) vs. chesshub (2339) which black won in 24.
moves.8. c3: This just leaves the bishop hanging.
moves.11... Nxe4: Now I have an extra pawn too.
moves.14... b6: I decide to develop my bishop on c8
moves.15... Ba6: Nice diagonal for my extra bishop
moves.16... Ke7: I connect my rooks. My king is quite safe in the centre with queens off the board.
moves.18. Rb1: I am not sure of the point of this move, maybe she had dreams of b3-b4-b5
moves.18... g5: I advance on the other wing, hitting her rook
moves.19... Nd2: Now I fork her rooks, one of them is lost
moves.20. Rbc1: She decides to keep the Rb1
moves.20... Nxf1: So I take the other one
moves.22... Rhd8: I get ready to by d7-d5 following by opening the d file for my rooks.
moves.23. Kg1: Strange move. With queens on the board, this would be a good safety move, but in this position the kings are safe enough in the centre. Ke2 would have been better, stopping my rook invasion which follows.
moves.23... d5: So I open the d file, also possibly increasing the scope of my Ba6
moves.24. h3: Not sure why she played this.
moves.26. Ncb5: Is this some sort of counter-attack? Is she hoping for Nc7 forking my rook on a8 and my bishop on a6?
moves.26... Bb7: This stops that and threatens g2
moves.27. c5: Not sure why she plays this either.
moves.28. Kf1: King comes back towards the centre.
moves.28... Rd8: Now I just need to get the other one into action to finish her off.
moves.29. Nxa7: This is another blunder, but white was lost anyway, it is mate soon
moves.29... Rdd2: Doubled rooks on the second rank are very powerful
moves.32... Rf1#: And this time it is mate. Many thanks for reading this dear reader. Please rate it on the star system and please leave a comment or two, to let me know how I am doing with my annotations! Until next time dear reader!
